page.title: 18ANIMAL FARMING IN SAMPFORD
page.content: Most of the farms are arable.However a few keep livestock.This varies with the farmers choice.In our area we can find: {Pigs}are intently farmed. Many pigs are kept together in each house.The breeding{sows}have their piglets which are kept for 14 weeks and fatterned for market.{Bullocks}are {male beef cows}which are allowed to graze in fields on grass.In winter they are fed on lesser quality ceral crops.These are kept for two years and sold for beef.{Sheep}are let to graze in paddocks with extra food when the grass is{poor.Ewes}produce{lambs which are fattened and sent to market. We have many families in our area who own small amounts of land.These people are called{smallholders}.They keep small numbers of many various types of livestock.this is mostly used to supply food for themselves.
